definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Let’s all buy the collection and decide for ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 让我们买这本集子，自己去判断吧。

sentences.english: All the letters of the late writer are compiled in this collection.
sentences.chinese: 这个集子辑录了这位已故作家的所有来往信件。

sentences.english: Who is right? Let's all buy the collection and decide for ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 到底谁是正确的？让我们买这本集子，自己去判断吧。

sentences.english: These are collected in a book that is To Littel Readers.
sentences.chinese: 这些都收在一个集子里出版，就是《寄小读者》。

sentences.english: There are many admiral samples in the collection.
sentences.chinese: 这部集子里有许多花蝶标本。

sentences.english: The first few episodes touched off a flurry of feedback from all corners of the campus.
sentences.chinese: 最初的集子引发了一阵来自公司各个方面的反馈。

sentences.english: I'm generally shelved among Snoopy calendars and collections of wisecracks .
sentences.chinese: 我的书通常被放在史努比和俏皮话集子中间。

sentences.english: All of these articles were collected in a book, which is To Little Readers.
sentences.chinese: 这些都收在一个集子里出版，就是《寄小读者》。

definition: author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]
a series of books/a collection of books
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
